etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in American Architect & Building News. From Italian arriccio from arricciare to curl or bristle up from ar- + riccio hedgehog

definitions: In fresco painting: a layer of fairly coarse plaster applied to the wall and left rough so that the smooth top layer which forms the painting surface may adhere to it more easily.

notes.text: The preliminary composition sketch is also executed on this layer of plaster.
